In-class Exercise 4

Author

Law Shiang Rou

Published

February 4, 2023

Modified

February 4, 2023

Loading required packages

Hide the code 
pacman::p_load(plotly, DT, patchwork, tidyverse, ggstatsplot)

Importing data

Hide the code 
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Working with Plot_ly() method

Hide the code 
plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
        x = ~ENGLISH, 
        y = ~MATHS, 
        color = ~RACE)

Changing color with color palette

Hide the code 
plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
        x = ~ENGLISH, 
        y = ~MATHS, 
        color = ~RACE, 
        colors = "Set1")

Changing to self-defined colors

Hide the code 
my_colors <- c("pink","skyblue","lightgreen","grey")
plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
        x = ~ENGLISH, 
        y = ~MATHS, 
        color = ~RACE, 
        colors = my_colors)

Working with ggplotly() method

Hide the code 
p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
            aes(x = MATHS,
                y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(dotsize = 1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))
ggplotly(p)

Coordinated Multiple Views with plotly

Hide the code 
d <- highlight_key(exam_data)  #<<
p1 <- ggplot(data=d, 
            aes(x = MATHS,
                y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

p2 <- ggplot(data=d, 
            aes(x = MATHS,
                y = SCIENCE)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))
subplot(ggplotly(p1),
        ggplotly(p2))

Working with ggstatsplot

Hide the code 
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam_data,
  x = GENDER, 
  y = MATHS,
  type = "np",
  messages = FALSE
)
